data.title: Murray State University Athletics
data.meta_description: Daniel Miller (34) Catcher - 2008: Served as the team’s top catcher...Appeared in 35 games with 31 starts...hit .193 eight RBIs and 14 runs scored...tied for...
data.text:
2008: Served as the team’s top catcher...Appeared in 35 games with 31 starts...hit .193 eight RBIs and 14 runs scored...tied for second on the team with four sacrifice hits...went 2-for-3 with a double, RBI and a run scored against Evansville...drove in a pair of runs against Ole Miss...had a two-hit effort in the series opener against Morehead State...ended the season with a two-RBI effort against Austin Peay.

2007: Helped turn a 1-2-3 double play at the plate in his first game of the season at Mississippi State...reached base in each of his first seven games of the season...had three pickoffs on the season, equaling the team-high...had a double against Evansville and a two-RBI game against South Dakota.

2006: One of three ’Breds to hit .300, playing in 13 games, with eight starts, and hitting .318...had two hits against Freed-Hardeman...caught two attempted base-stealers in eight attempts.

BEFORE MSU: Played four seasons at Ballard High...received all-district and all-region honors as a senior...named to the Kentucky East-West Seniors All-Star Game...was a 7th Region All-Star as a junior and senior.
